turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Can you be more specific?
Could you give us, for example, an example of an act that might be taken under appropriate instructions, under 7 and 8, that would not go so far as 9 and 10, but which would affect voting?

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --I... right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Because your brother--

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: Right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: --in effect is saying there's no such thing.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --Right.

I think that it's possible that a commission... the Commissioner might give the master the full authority on the face of the statute, and under that situation you might have a situation in which the--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Not authority that would go so far as 9 and 10.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --Right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Right.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: But still, you might have... still... I mean, the... well, under 9, for example, the board of managers can just say, I'm going to do a new budget, you know.
I don't care what the school district's old budget said.
Now... but I think under 8, or under 7 or 8 he has... he may have in effect the same power, although it has to be... or almost the same power, although it's exercised in a different way.
I think it's important to note the State--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Well, how does it work?
Let's... you're talking about budgets.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --Right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Can you give me a budget hypothesis that would--

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: The State... the school district--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: --That would not go so far as 9 and 10?

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --The school district has a budget, and the master or the management team takes a look at it and says, you know, I don't like this budget.
I think that you have to completely rewrite it.

You have to make it 20 percent less, reallocate, you know, less on building schools and more on teacher training and school books, and if you don't... and so you just take this back and write a new budget.
I think that is probably... that we would think that is a de facto replacement along with all the others powers, because even though the school district--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Is it any way that it would be a de facto replacement in a way that would implicate the discriminatory concerns of the section 5?

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --It could.
I mean, I do want to say just because it's a--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: How?

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --Well, I do want to say just because it's a de facto replacement doesn't mean it does.
I mean, it may--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --It may be perfectly okay.

But I do think there are situations... for example, suppose that because of demographic changes a school district for the first time becomes majority Hispanic, or majority black, or substantial minority such that the Hispanics and blacks can for the first time influence who the... influence the election of the... of their elected officials, and then all of a sudden the Commissioner decides to implement... decides we don't like that, you know... I'm not... you know, we want to have an appointee who's responsible to the Commissioner.
Now, I'm not saying that has happened or will happen, but there are--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: So you're saying the choice of educational policy, reflected in a budget, can also be a reflection of--

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --Of school--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: --Of racial composition, and if you affect that, then it is a voting--

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --I think it--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: --It is a de facto replacement that would be covered by 5.

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --I think that the--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: That's your argument?

turn.speaker: paul_r_q_wolfson
turn.label: Mr. Paul R. Q. Wolfson
turn.text: --I think that the budget reflects... you know, among other things reflects the entire policy that the school board, the elected school board wants.
That's what people elect... when people elect a school board they elect them in order to make various policy judgments, some of which are reflected in a budget, and the master may disagree.
Thank you very much.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Thank you, Mr. Wolfson.
The case is submitted.
